text: In algebraic topology, a simplicial homotopypg 23 is an analog of a homotopy between topological spaces for simplicial sets. If :f, g: X \to Y are maps between simplicial sets, a simplicial homotopy from f to g is a map :h: X \times \triangle^{1} \to Y such that the diagram (see ) formed by f, g and h commute; the key is to use the diagram that results in f(x) = h(x, 0) and g(x) = h(x, 1) for all x in X. == See also == *Kan complex *Dold–Kan correspondence (under which a chain homotopy corresponds to a simplicial homotopy) *Simplicial homology ==References== == External links == *http://ncatlab.org/nlab/show/simplicial+homotopy Category:Homotopy theory Category:Simplicial sets
title: Simplicial homotopy
